title: Did Boris Johnson Just Outfox Himself on Brexit?
text:
LONDON — It was supposed to be a day of victory for Prime Minister Boris Johnson, the day his carefully laid Brexit plans moved closer to fruition with British lawmakers sidelined from the action.

Instead, for Britain’s bare-knuckled new prime minister, Monday marked the end of what is surely one of the most abysmal starts any British leader has ever endured. Mr. Johnson had thought he could outfox Parliament by suspending it and controlling the Brexit timetable, but he is the one who has been outmaneuvered.

In the waning hours of their last day in session until mid-October, lawmakers were poised to deliver yet another defeat: the rejection of the prime minister’s bid for a snap election. And that loss came on the same day a new law rammed through by Parliament took effect that prevents him from carrying through on his threat to force through a no-deal Brexit.

Now, the man who promised to deliver Britain’s withdrawal from the European Union “do or die” is suddenly flailing for a new strategy, more than three years after Britain voted to leave the European Union in a referendum.
description: Monday was supposed to be a day of triumph for Britain’s new prime minister. Instead, he seemed headed for a fifth defeat in an inauspicious debut.
